full_summary:
Title
------------

W2282-23AA78A Medical Training Support
================================================================olsonwritingintent='Ti'

Offer Title: Medical Training Support

Issuing Agency: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)

The Government of Canada is seeking proposals from qualified Offerors to provide medical training support to the Department of National Defence (DND) for a period of three (3) years, with an option to extend the contract by up to one (1) additional year.

Background
------------

The contract supports the design, development, and delivery of Canadian Forces Health Services Group Training and Education programs.

Key Requirements
----------------

* The Offeror must demonstrate experience in providing medical training services.
* The Offeror must have the necessary expertise to support the security requirements associated with the contract.
* The Offeror must provide proof of liability insurance.

Evaluation Criteria
-------------------

Proposals will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

* Lowest cost-per-point (LCPP)
* Expertise and experience in providing medical training services
* Ability to meet the security requirements associated with the contract
* Proof of liability insurance

Important Dates
----------------

*   Tender Submission Deadline: January 23, 2024, at 2:00 PM EST
*   Expected Contract Start Date: December 29, 2023

Contact Information
-----------------

Diane Reynolds (DND/SPAC)
diane.reynolds@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

Note
----

This solicitation is open to business and individuals with the necessary expertise and experience to meet the requirements of the contract. Interested parties may access the solicitation on the Federal Procurement Gateway website at [https://buyandsell.gc.ca/auth/register?language=en](https://buyandsell.gc.ca/auth/register?language=en).

Supplementary Information
------------------------

This solicitation is subject to the provisions of the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP) and the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA). The contract award will be made based on the evaluation criteria and in accordance with the Federal Procurement Policy.
